10

Economy looks weaker
in latest jobs report

Romney, Obama put spin on jobs report

US employers created only 69,000 jobs last month, the fewest in a year, as the jobless rate climbed and the stock market slipped today. (AP, 2:20 p.m.)
  • Romney hits Obama for May uptick in unemployment rate
  • Stocks fall sharply after jobs report | Check markets
  • Spring job slump still looks like an improvement

Zimmerman's bond in Fla. revoked

Geroge Zimmerman, the neighborhood watch volunteer charged with killing Trayvon Martin, 17, must return to jail within 48 hours, a judge ruled. (AP, 3:39 p.m.)
  • Pictures Zimmerman in court | 5/29 Media want access
  • 5/8 Fund pays shooter's bills | 4/23 Suspect fading away

Suffolk DA drops rape charge against former BU hockey player

The charges against Max Nicastro were dropped today by Suffolk County prosecutors who wrote in court papers they were not able to prove the case. (Globe, 12:20 p.m.)
  • 2/28 BU to probe hockey culture | BU task force named
  • 2/20 BU hockey’s Nicastro arrested on rape charge

Pictures: Red Sox power rankings

Chad Finn measures the best, including catcher Jarrod Saltalamacchia, and the worst, such as a few starting pitchers, of the Red Sox in May.

  • Ask Nick: Could Carl Crawford need surgery?
